YOU ARE SELLING SKINS... THIS IS NOT 3RD PERSON LIKE FORTNITE, YOU CAN'T SEE THE SKINS YOU BUY.   So clueless.

Every single power-shooter / hero game sells NEW CHARACTERS.  This game is not competitive and can afford to release frequent new heroes.  Take notes from how Valorant / league of legends / Apex makes money from new characters with the ability to earn them free.

Eu sou um pai de 45 anos, provavelmente uma das pessoas mais velhas a jogar este jogo. Sou pai solteiro criando meu filho, que agora tem 14 anos. Meu filho ganhou este jogo no Natal de 2021 de seu tio, ent√£o o instalamos em seu computador e ele come√ßou a jogar. At√© o final da semana ele tinha 24 horas neste jogo. Isso foi horr√≠vel para mim, pois j√° era dif√≠cil encontrar maneiras de passar o tempo com meu filho, pois ele est√° sempre com os amigos ou apenas assistindo ao YouTube. Ent√£o eu decidi fazer uma conta no Battle.net e pegar esse jogo para ver se eu poderia jogar ao lado dele. Eu comprei o jogo, escolhi minha skin e mundo e comecei a jogar, mas eu estava preso no que voc√™ deveria fazer. Pedi ajuda ao meu filho e ele organizou um jogo para eu participar. Adorei, pois foi o melhor momento que passei com meu filho desde que minha esposa morreu. Desde ent√£o, esse jogo aproximou eu e meu filho novamente e agora passamos um tempo juntos fora de casa tamb√©m. Este jogo me lembrou que h√° divers√£o em tudo, e trouxe muitas lembran√ßas felizes para mim e meu filho. Uma pena a empresa ter estragado o jogo.

Leaving the game open long enough on Steam to leave a negative review. 

Seriously though, if you don't have money to spend on games and you've exhausted every other option, go ahead, waste time on this dumpster fire. Blizz took away OW1 from those of us that paid for it back when and now we're left with a inferior product 'for free'. The lootboxes from before sucked, sure, but you got one per level and could unlock everything from just playing. Now you must sink more time than reasonable into a product that doesn't respect your time to get any kind of result. 

AVOID THIS GAME AND BLIZZARD IN GENERAL, THIS COMPANY DOESN'T RESPECT YOUR TIME OR MONEY.

This review is gonna be short and sweet. 

The game is good. Amazing, even. Fluid gameplay, great artstyle, fun characters. There are[i] very [/i]few games that feel as good to play as Overwatch does. 

Now yes, the monetisation is annoying, and Blizzard has had terrible communication with it's plans for OW2. But this isn't a review of the company or it's business model. It's a review of the game. OW is only following in the footsteps of the entire gaming industry so that it can survive. Does that make it a bad game? Who knows, but for now, you'll never find another game like it
Remember how OW2 supposed to have PvE? Fuck Blizzard

Releasing on Steam is the first good decision involving this game in a very, very long time.

Unfortunately nowhere near good enough to put out the dumpster fire they throw their waste into every hour on the hour.
Glad that everything promised is in there!

Having pre-ordered the game since launch, it's been quite a few years with Overwatch. I've had some good memories, and obviously some bad ones. Overwatch had great potential, and the spark of joy when playing it at launch was fantastic. But unfortunately, the developers have stripped the game's potential away, milking it heavily and under delivering on their promises.

The entire premise of OW2 was scrapped within a year of the making, yet they took several years, ignored their first game for it, and then went back on several promises. It was entirely made just to add a few maps, 3 heroes, remove several maps, and remove the method of obtaining skins for free, instead opting for a paid currency for the majority of skins, and a battle pass system as well. 

The worst part is the PVE - the trailers showed such fantastic ideas which were already finished development - talent trees, upgraded abilities, environmental interaction like knocking robots into walls/other robots, and even having enemies with limbs that you could shoot off, impacting their capabilities. While I understand that some of this may have been a bit ambitious, they pulled the worst possible move and delivered none after years of expectations.

I can't recommend this game anymore, not for the gameplay (which while it had its issues across several seasons has been fun for the most part), but for the horrible business decisions of the company, clearly not valuing their playerbase.

I'll miss you Jet Set Radio Frog, but luckily I have Bomb Rush Cyberfunk coming out soon anyways.

Even the tutorial for Team Fortress 2 was way better than just WASD, mouse 1 (shoot badguys),  mouse 2 (ability), shift (run button), e (heal), ultimate (hold m1 to kill enemies no aim required), and capture a point by standing on it with no danger in sight. I learned so much from that thanks Blizzard Entertainment, Inc.!  Blizzard Entertainment, Inc. has shown that they have not learned from the 16 years of greatness that is Team Fortress 2, the best sequel of all time.
Team Fortress 2 > Overwatch 2.

55 lvl on BATTLE PASS to unlock the character
you have to grind 6 months for 1 skin or 1 character and if you don't want to grind you have to pay 10 euros

All new characters that are added are so op that no one even picks adc anymore because support does 2 times more damage and can heal by the way, the same applies to tanks.

Overwatch is a good game , but Blizzard u r piece of sh1t !!!!
What were they thinking releasing it on a platform where people can review games?
Moving Overwatch to steam, is just another way to squeeze people out of their money. It makes me mad to see how the state of this game has deteriorated in the last years, just like destiny 2 has.

Overwatch multiplayer is like just overhauled Overwatch 1 and it's the good part of the game
But removal of lootboxes and addition of a shop plus cancellation of Overwatch 2 campaign is the reason why this game is hated by many now. It's not that it's a bad game, it still can be fun. But sadly the reason why many waited for Overwatch 2 was cancelled and the fun of grinding for skins has been eradicated.

My view on this game is neutral but I enjoy the gameplay.
